string.text: Radiation protection drugs are common in the Zone. When used, this drug induces contraction of peripheral blood vessels and oxygen deprivation, which serves to treat and prevent radiation exposure. The drug does not have severe side effects, although isolated cases of mild nausea, dizziness, cramps and stomach pain have been reported.

A normal elastic bandage used to stop bleeding and prevent infection of wounds. For regular bleeding, carefully apply the bandage to the wound. For arterial bleeding, urgently tie the bandage around the affected area.
Standard issue military binoculars with a maximum of x7.5 magnification. Useful in the Zone in that they allow its owner to observe things from a distance.
No bakers have ever been identified in the Zone, but this bread is neither contaminated nor radioactive, being fresh and quite edible. At least no complaints have been reported thus far.

Presumably, these canned goods were looted by stalkers from an army ration depot. Without any kind of label on the can, it’s hard to say for sure. Should still be good to eat, if you believe the best before date.

This dated anomalous activity detector produces an alarm signal when anomalous particles enter a special chamber as you approach an anomaly. It can also register the presence of artefacts and measure the distance to the nearest one. The distance is indicated by the frequency of the sound the detector emits. To switch to artefact search mode, open the device’s front cover. Due to its simple design, Echo can only be used to locate the most common artefacts.

A next generation scientific detection scanner. Thanks to three modernized detection chambers, the position of artefacts is shown on a special display screen. When closed, the device registers only radiation and anomalies. To switch to artefact search mode, open the front LED display. When in search mode, the detector is capable of locating all artefacts known to science.

A prototype of an expanded functionality anomalous frequency scanner. This device comes with a program used to identify static areas of anomalous activity stored in its database, while retaining the ability to locate artefacts. The position of anomalous areas and artefacts is displayed on a special screen. The artefact search mode, which can be activated by opening the front LED display, has been modified to detect anomalous formations currently unknown to science.
A standard head-mounted flashlight. Useful for stalkers who find themselves out and about after dark, but may attract trouble if used unwisely.

A complex drug comprising several antidotes, including metoclopramidum, pyridoxine, thiamine, riboxin and other pharmaceuticals. The drug is used to inject a range of antibiotics to neutralize natural poisons, together with synthetic poison absorbers, into the bloodstream. IP2 is not particularly popular in the Zone, as most stalkers rely on a gas mask and a protective suit, there are still those who have a pack of this antidote stashed away. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

An artificial equivalent of vitamin K. The main purpose of this drug is to increase blood coagulation speed. In great demand among stalkers who want slow-healing wounds and lacerations inflicted by mutants to close up faster. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

A drug that blocks avalanche-like nerve impulses. Consumption induces short-term loss of all emotion. Used exclusively in the Zone to counteract the effects of anomalous psi-fields. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

Often used by stalkers on long trips when no breaks can be afforded. The drink contains easily digestible carbohydrates, as well as drugs that stimulate the release of adrenaline into the bloodstream.
For better or worse, this sausage—a mix of chicken and a soy substitute—is often a stalker’s breakfast, lunch and dinner in one. Can be stored for a long time due to high preservative content.

A specialized medical kit for providing first aid to combat casualties. The kit includes blood coagulants based on menadione, painkillers, antibiotics and immunostimulants, as well as a kit for removing bullets and fragments from the body. This medkit is issued to army personnel as standard and is sometimes used by Duty forces.
A general purpose medical kit with a HEALTH-13 type injector. Handy for treating various injuries—wounds, bruises, regular and chemical burns and various types of poisoning. In demand among stalkers.

A medical kit designed specifically for use in the Zone. The kit contains products for handling wounds, as well as preventing the development of radiation poisoning and reducing accumulated radiation in the body. Contains Vikasolum, Batilolum and Naphazoline, unlike other medkits.
Made by GSC. Goes down easy and considerably lowers the effects of radiation. Should be enjoyed in moderation.

This last generation anomalous activity detector can be used to locate anomalous formations and has a colour diode panel, which not only indicates the direction of artifacts, but also measures the distance to them. To switch to artifact search mode, open the device’s front cover. Unfortunately, the device is programmed with a somewhat outdated list of detectable artefacts.

An experimental drug developed by Professor Ozersky for scientific research teams working in the Zone. At its core, the drug contains tetrodotoxin, known colloquially as “zombie powder,” which causes a complete shutdown of the body’s central nervous system that may allow people to survive emissions outside cover. The drug has not undergone clinical or field testing, which puts its effectiveness in doubt and raises the quesition of possible side effects.
A 32x100 bolt. A stalker’s best friend.

The main component of this product is an anabolic androgen, an artificial steroid, the chemical composition of which resembles testosterone. Often used by stalkers during long raids to reduce muscle fatigue. Significantly increases weight-carrying capacity. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

A radioprotectant, included in medkits issued to nuclear power plant personnel. Used in the Zone instead of the excessively toxic PC1 cystamine hydrochloride, repeated use of which often caused death. Reduces the effects of gamma radiation on live tissue. Best consumed before exposure, as effects are not instant. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.
GPS markers are used in the Zone for marking stashes. If the marker is placed inside a stash, the stash will show up on your map along with a list of the stash’s contents.

A sleeping bag is one easiest ways to get some sleep in the Zone. However, it does not protect its user from radiation, so if you want to sleep in it, you better find some place that’s protected from blowouts.
A stalker’s note written on a sheet of paper torn out of a notebook. To read, click “Use.”
A stalker’s note written on a sheet of paper torn out of a notebook. To read, click “Use.”
This PDA used to belong to a stalker nicknamed Scavenger. It is not locked and can be accessed. To open, click “Use.”

The Barmitsa-PC radio transmitter is used to contact Russian military radio stations, such as R-159, R-163, R-168, and others. It is equipped wiuth a built in voice changer. The radio is built for military use in the field and is therefore very light and damage-resistant.
This device was made by scientists working in the Zone in order to see safe paths in anomalous areas. It can also block the activity of weak anomalous fields. Requires batteries.
Sometimes, writing things down can help you find solutions…
A metal container used for storing loot, secured by a complex lock.
A device used for tracking radio signals within a large radius. In the Zone, this device can be used to locate stalkers by the signal of their PDAs.
This key is used to open the armory containing the stockpile.
According to Sidorovich, this flash drive has some very valuable information and it used belong to a stalker named Klim. This is the flashdrive Sidorovich asked me to bring.
Sidorovich has given me this fairly heavy case and told me to give it to Orest. He hasn’t told me what’s inside, and, to be honest, I don’t really want to know.
This PDA used to belong to Father Valerian, who is now dead. The PDA is locked, and I can’t access it.
This very sharp hunting knife most likely belongs to the one who killed Lefty. If I can find the owner, then I can find out the murderer.
This PDA belonged to Chemist, the man who killed Lefty and Limp. This PDA might have some more useful information may prove he is, in fact, the murderer.
A PDA of dead stalker, whose body I found not far from the military outpost in Cordon.
A PDA, formerly possessed by deceased Freedom leader Miklukha. The PDA is password protected, so I can’t access it.

The R-250M2 is a communications receiver that works on short waves and is favored by many radio hobbyists. Two versions of this receiver have been produced: the R250/M/M2 for land forces and R-670/M for the Russian Navy. The original 1949 version was a dual conversion superheterodyne with a tuning range of 1.5–25.5 MHz spread over twelve bands. The final version, the R-250M2, was produced from 1968 until 1980. The main change was the tube type, as the set moved from metal octal tubes to miniature tubes.
Shell is dead, and all he had on him was his dogtag. I should show this to Marcus.
A backup key to the Outpost cell. Since the death of Chemist, the key has been kept by Sologub, who leaves the key on the cupboard so that other guards can use it if necessary.

Flesh meat is both tasty and highly nutritious. It is recommend not to eat it raw, as there is high chance that the meat is infected with trichinosis or brucellosis. Such infections will infect the stalker who ingests them and cause symptoms that include but are not limited to fever, tiredness, and loss of appetite. The symptoms may prove fatal in the Zone, where danger lurks in every corner.

Boar meat, highly nutritious and perfectly edible. It is recommend not to eat it raw, as there is high chance that the meat is infected with trichinosis or brucellosis. Such infections will infect the stalker who ingests them and cause symptoms that include but are not limited to fever, tiredness, and loss of appetite. The symptoms may prove fatal in the Zone, where danger lurks in every corner.

Meat from a blind dog. Not as appetizing as flesh or boar meat, but still perfectly edible. It is recommend not to eat it raw, as there is high chance that the meat is infected with trichinosis or brucellosis. Such infections will infect the stalker who ingests them and cause symptoms that include but are not limited to fever, tiredness, and loss of appetite. The symptoms may prove fatal in the Zone, where danger lurks in every corner.

Tasty, edible flesh meat. It is recommend not to eat it raw, as there is high chance that the meat is infected with trichinosis or brucellosis. Such infections will infect the stalker who ingests them and cause symptoms that include but are not limited to fever, tiredness, and loss of appetite. The symptoms may prove fatal in the Zone, where danger lurks in every corner.
 
%c[0,204,0,51] • %c[0,140,140,140] Poisonous food
%c[0,204,0,51] • %c[0,140,140,140] Radiation: %c[0,170,170,170] +584 mSv

Highly nutritious and perfectly edible boar meat. It is recommend not to eat it raw, as there is high chance that the meat is infected with trichinosis or brucellosis. Such infections will infect the stalker who ingests them and cause symptoms that include but are not limited to fever, tiredness, and loss of appetite. The symptoms may prove fatal in the Zone, where danger lurks in every corner.
 
%c[0,204,0,51] • %c[0,140,140,140] Poisonous food
%c[0,204,0,51] • %c[0,140,140,140] Radiation: %c[0,170,170,170] +646 mSv

Blind dog meat. Not as good as flesh or boar meat, but still perfectly edible. It is recommend not to eat it raw, as there is high chance that the meat is infected with trichinosis or brucellosis. Such infections will infect the stalker who ingests them and cause symptoms that include but are not limited to fever, tiredness, and loss of appetite. The symptoms may prove fatal in the Zone, where danger lurks in every corner.
 
%c[0,204,0,51] • %c[0,140,140,140] Poisonous food
%c[0,204,0,51] • %c[0,140,140,140] Radiation: %c[0,170,170,170] +202 mSv
An empty canteen. It can hold up to 0.7 liters.
A canteen filled with water. Contains enough for 1 use.
A canteen filled with water. Contains enough for 2 uses.
A canteen full of water. Contains enough for 3 uses.

A lithium-ion battery that’s feat for radios. It has a fairly large capacity. It doesn’t seem to have suffered any damage, which is very lucky considering this battery was taken out of a broken radio transmitter.
A metallic jerry can with a 10 liter capacity. Filled with diesel fuel.
A bag containing 5 bolts. Stalkers enjoy storing bolts in bags of this type.
